props.name: autoCreate

props.name: title
props.desc: Default text to display in the title bar (defaults to null)

props.name: width
props.desc: Width of the dialog in pixels (can also be set via CSS).  Determined by browser if unspecified.

props.name: height
props.desc: Height of the dialog in pixels (can also be set via CSS).  Determined by browser if unspecified.

props.name: x
props.desc: The default left page coordinate of the dialog (defaults to center screen)

props.name: y
props.desc: The default top page coordinate of the dialog (defaults to center screen)

props.name: animateTarget
props.desc:
Id or element from which the dialog should animate while opening
(defaults to null with no animation)

props.name: resizable
props.desc: False to disable manual dialog resizing (defaults to true)

props.name: resizeHandles
props.desc:
Which resize handles to display - see the {@link Roo.Resizable} handles config
property for valid values (defaults to 'all')

props.name: minHeight
props.desc: The minimum allowable height for a resizable dialog (defaults to 80)

props.name: minWidth
props.desc: The minimum allowable width for a resizable dialog (defaults to 200)

props.name: modal
props.desc: True to show the dialog modally, preventing user interaction with the rest of the page (defaults to false)

props.name: autoScroll
props.desc: True to allow the dialog body contents to overflow and display scrollbars (defaults to false)

props.name: closable
props.desc: False to remove the built-in top-right corner close button (defaults to true)

props.name: collapsible
props.desc: False to remove the built-in top-right corner collapse button (defaults to true)

props.name: constraintoviewport
props.desc: True to keep the dialog constrained within the visible viewport boundaries (defaults to true)

props.name: syncHeightBeforeShow
props.desc: True to cause the dimensions to be recalculated before the dialog is shown (defaults to false)

props.name: draggable
props.desc: False to disable dragging of the dialog within the viewport (defaults to true)

props.name: autoTabs
props.desc: If true, all elements with class 'x-dlg-tab' will get automatically converted to tabs (defaults to false)

props.name: tabTag
props.desc: The tag name of tab elements, used when autoTabs = true (defaults to 'div')

props.name: proxyDrag
props.desc:
True to drag a lightweight proxy element rather than the dialog itself, used when
draggable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: fixedcenter
props.desc: True to ensure that anytime the dialog is shown or resized it gets centered (defaults to false)

props.name: shadow
props.desc:
True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right
shadow (defaults to false)

props.name: shadowOffset
props.desc: The number of pixels to offset the shadow if displayed (defaults to 5)

props.name: buttonAlign
props.desc: Valid values are "left," "center" and "right" (defaults to "right")

props.name: minButtonWidth
props.desc: Minimum width of all dialog buttons (defaults to 75)

props.name: buttons

props.name: shim
props.desc: True to create an iframe shim that prevents selects from showing through (defaults to false)

events.name: beforecomplete
events.desc:
Fires after a change has been made to the field, but before the change is reflected in the underlying
field.  Saving the change to the field can be canceled by returning false from the handler of this event.
Note that if the value has not changed and ignoreNoChange = true, the editing will still end but this
event will not fire since no edit actually occurred.

props.name: totalProperty
props.desc:
Name of the property from which to retrieve the total number of records
in the dataset. This is only needed if the whole dataset is not passed in one go, but is being
paged from the remote server.

props.name: successProperty
props.desc: Name of the property from which to retrieve the success attribute used by forms.

props.name: root
props.desc: name of the property which contains the Array of row objects.

props.name: id
props.desc: Name of the property within a row object that contains a record identifier value.

props.name: fields
props.desc: An array of field definition objects, or field name strings.

props.name: isLocal
props.desc:
flag if data is locally available (and can be always looked up
without a remote query - used by combo/forms at present.

props.name: proxy
props.desc: The Proxy object which provides access to a data object.

props.name: data
props.desc: Inline data to be loaded when the store is initialized.

props.name: reader
props.desc: The Reader object which processes the data object and returns an Array of Roo.data.record objects which are cached keyed by their id property.

props.name: baseParams
props.desc:
An object containing properties which are to be sent as parameters
on any HTTP request

props.name: sortInfo
props.desc: A config object in the format: {field: "fieldName", direction: "ASC|DESC"}

props.name: multiSort
props.desc: enable multi column sorting (sort is based on the order of columns, remote only at present)

props.name: remoteSort
props.desc:
True if sorting is to be handled by requesting the Proxy to provide a refreshed
version of the data object in sorted order, as opposed to sorting the Record cache in place (defaults to false).

props.name: pruneModifiedRecords
props.desc:
True to clear all modified record information each time the store is
loaded or when a record is removed. (defaults to false).

the load action will be canceled.

events.name: datachanged
events.desc:
Fires when the data cache has changed, and a widget which is using this Store
as a Record cache should refresh its view.

events.desc: Fires after a new set of Records has been loaded.

events.name: loadexception

Fires if an exception occurs in the Proxy during loading.

events.desc: Fires when this store's reader provides new metadata (fields). This is currently only support for JsonReaders.

events.desc: Fires when a Record has been updated

props.name: listeners

events.name: drop
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the dragged item has
been dropped on it.  This method has no default implementation and returns false, so you must provide an
implementation that does something to process the drop event and returns true so that the drag source's
repair action does not run.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.success

events.name: enter
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the source is now over the
target.  This default implementation adds the CSS class specified by overClass (if any) to the drop element
and returns the dropAllowed config value.  This method should be overridden if drop validation is required.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.overClass and this.dropAllowed

events.name: out
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the source has been dragged
out of the target without dropping.  This default implementation simply removes the CSS class specified by
overClass (if any) from the drop element.

events.name: over
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls continuously while it is being dragged over the target.
This method will be called on every mouse movement while the drag source is over the drop target.
This default implementation simply returns the dropAllowed config value.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.dropAllowed

props.name: overClass
props.desc: The CSS class applied to the drop target element while the drag source is over it (defaults to "").

props.name: ddGroup
props.desc: The drag drop group to handle drop events for

props.name: dropAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-ok").

props.name: dropNotAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-nodrop").

props.name: success
props.desc: set this after drop listener..

props.name: valid
props.desc:
true/false or string (ok-add/ok-sub/ok/nodrop)
if the drop point is valid for over/enter..

props.name: listeners

events.name: drop
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the dragged item has
been dropped on it.  This method has no default implementation and returns false, so you must provide an
implementation that does something to process the drop event and returns true so that the drag source's
repair action does not run.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.success

events.name: enter
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the source is now over the
target.  This default implementation adds the CSS class specified by overClass (if any) to the drop element
and returns the dropAllowed config value.  This method should be overridden if drop validation is required.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.overClass and this.dropAllowed

events.name: out
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls once to notify this drop target that the source has been dragged
out of the target without dropping.  This default implementation simply removes the CSS class specified by
overClass (if any) from the drop element.

events.name: over
events.desc:
The function a {@link Roo.dd.DragSource} calls continuously while it is being dragged over the target.
This method will be called on every mouse movement while the drag source is over the drop target.
This default implementation simply returns the dropAllowed config value.

IMPORTANT : it should set this.dropAllowed

props.name: dropAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class to apply to the status element when drop is allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-ok").

props.name: dropNotAllowed
props.desc: The CSS class to apply to the status element when drop is not allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-nodrop").

This is completely optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON.

props.name: lazyRender
props.desc:
True to prevent the ComboBox from rendering until requested (should always be used when
rendering into an Roo.Editor, defaults to false)

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to:
{tag: "input", type: "text", size: "24", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: store
props.desc: The data store to which this combo is bound (defaults to undefined)

props.name: title
props.desc:
If supplied, a header element is created containing this text and added into the top of
the dropdown list (defaults to undefined, with no header element)

props.name: tpl
props.desc: The template to use to render the output

props.name: listWidth
props.desc: The width in pixels of the dropdown list (defaults to the width of the ComboBox field)

props.name: displayField
props.desc:
The underlying data field name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'text' if mode = 'local')

props.name: valueField
props.desc:
The underlying data value name to bind to this CombBox (defaults to undefined if
mode = 'remote' or 'value' if mode = 'local'). 
Note: use of a valueField requires the user make a selection
in order for a value to be mapped.

props.name: hiddenName
props.desc:
If specified, a hidden form field with this name is dynamically generated to store the
field's data value (defaults to the underlying DOM element's name)

props.name: listClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the dropdown list element (defaults to '')

props.name: selectedClass
props.desc: CSS class to apply to the selected item in the dropdown list (defaults to 'x-combo-selected')

props.name: triggerClass
props.desc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the class 'x-form-trigger' and triggerClass will be appended if specified (defaults to 'x-form-arrow-trigger' which displays a downward arrow icon).

props.name: shadow
props.desc: True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right

props.name: listAlign
props.desc:
A valid anchor position value. See {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for details on supported
anchor positions (defaults to 'tl-bl')

props.name: maxHeight
props.desc: The maximum height in pixels of the dropdown list before scrollbars are shown (defaults to 300)

props.name: triggerAction
props.desc:
The action to execute when the trigger field is activated.  Use 'all' to run the
query specified by the allQuery config option (defaults to 'query')

props.name: minChars
props.desc:
The minimum number of characters the user must type before autocomplete and typeahead activate
(defaults to 4, does not apply if editable = false)

props.name: typeAhead
props.desc:
True to populate and autoselect the remainder of the text being typed after a configurable
delay (typeAheadDelay) if it matches a known value (defaults to false)

props.name: queryDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the start of typing and sending the
query to filter the dropdown list (defaults to 500 if mode = 'remote' or 10 if mode = 'local')

props.name: pageSize
props.desc:
If greater than 0, a paging toolbar is displayed in the footer of the dropdown list and the
filter queries will execute with page start and limit parameters.  Only applies when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 0)

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc:
True to select any existing text in the field immediately on focus.  Only applies
when editable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: queryParam
props.desc: Name of the query as it will be passed on the querystring (defaults to 'query')

props.name: loadingText
props.desc:
The text to display in the dropdown list while data is loading.  Only applies
when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 'Loading...')

props.name: resizable
props.desc: True to add a resize handle to the bottom of the dropdown list (defaults to false)

props.name: handleHeight
props.desc: The height in pixels of the dropdown list resize handle if resizable = true (defaults to 8)

props.name: editable
props.desc:
False to prevent the user from typing text directly into the field, just like a
traditional select (defaults to true)

props.name: allQuery
props.desc: The text query to send to the server to return all records for the list with no filtering (defaults to '')

props.name: mode
props.desc: Set to 'local' if the ComboBox loads local data (defaults to 'remote' which loads from the server)

props.name: minListWidth
props.desc:
The minimum width of the dropdown list in pixels (defaults to 70, will be ignored if
listWidth has a higher value)

props.name: forceSelection
props.desc:
True to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, false to
allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field (defaults to false)

props.name: typeAheadDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed
if typeAhead = true (defaults to 250)

props.name: valueNotFoundText
props.desc:
When using a name/value combo, if the value passed to setValue is not found in
the store, valueNotFoundText will be displayed as the field text if defined (defaults to undefined)

props.name: blockFocus
props.desc: Prevents all focus calls, so it can work with things like HTML edtor bar

props.name: disableClear
props.desc: Disable showing of clear button.

when editable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: queryParam
props.desc: Name of the query as it will be passed on the querystring (defaults to 'query')

props.name: loadingText
props.desc:
The text to display in the dropdown list while data is loading.  Only applies
when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 'Loading...')

props.name: resizable
props.desc: True to add a resize handle to the bottom of the dropdown list (defaults to false)

props.name: handleHeight
props.desc: The height in pixels of the dropdown list resize handle if resizable = true (defaults to 8)

props.name: editable
props.desc:
False to prevent the user from typing text directly into the field, just like a
traditional select (defaults to true)

props.name: allQuery
props.desc: The text query to send to the server to return all records for the list with no filtering (defaults to '')

props.name: mode
props.desc: Set to 'local' if the ComboBox loads local data (defaults to 'remote' which loads from the server)

props.name: minListWidth
props.desc:
The minimum width of the dropdown list in pixels (defaults to 70, will be ignored if
listWidth has a higher value)

props.name: forceSelection
props.desc:
True to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, false to
allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field (defaults to false)

props.name: typeAheadDelay
props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed
if typeAhead = true (defaults to 250)

props.name: valueNotFoundText
props.desc:
When using a name/value combo, if the value passed to setValue is not found in
the store, valueNotFoundText will be displayed as the field text if defined (defaults to undefined)

props.name: blockFocus
props.desc: Prevents all focus calls, so it can work with things like HTML edtor bar

props.name: disableClear
props.desc: Disable showing of clear button.

props.name: alwaysQuery
props.desc: Disable caching of results, and always send query

props.name: hideTrigger
props.desc: True to hide the trigger element and display only the base text field (defaults to false)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

props.name: emptyText
props.desc: The default text to display in an empty field (defaults to null).

props.name: emptyClass
props.desc:
The CSS class to apply to an empty field to style the {@link #emptyText} (defaults to
'x-form-empty-field').  This class is automatically added and removed as needed depending on the current field value.

props.desc: Label to use when rendering a form.

props.desc: Mouse over tip

props.name: name
props.desc: The field's HTML name attribute.

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: invalidText
props.desc: The error text to use when marking a field invalid and no message is provided (defaults to "The value in this field is invalid")

props.name: focusClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

props.name: validationEvent
props.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

props.name: validateOnBlur
props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay
props.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

props.name: fieldClass
props.desc: The default CSS class for the field (defaults to "x-form-field")

The location where error text should display. Should be one of the following values (defaults to 'qtip'): 
Value         Description
-----------   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
qtip          Display a quick tip when the user hovers over the field
title         Display a default browser title attribute popup
under         Add a block div beneath the field containing the error text
side          Add an error icon to the right of the field with a popup on hover
[element id]  Add the error text directly to the innerHTML of the specified element

props.desc: Experimental The effect used when displaying a validation message under the field (defaults to 'normal').

props.desc: The type attribute for input fields -- e.g. radio, text, password (defaults to "text").

props.name: cls
props.desc: A CSS class to apply to the field's underlying element.

props.name: width
props.desc: width (optional) size of component

props.name: height
props.desc: height (optional) size of component

props.name: disableClass
props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.name: allowDomMove
props.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

props.name: hideMode
props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

props.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

props.name: format
props.desc:
The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support.  The format must be
valid according to {@link Date#parseDate} (defaults to 'm/d/y').

props.name: altFormats
props.desc:
Multiple date formats separated by "|" to try when parsing a user input value and it doesn't match the defined
format (defaults to 'm/d/Y|m-d-y|m-d-Y|m/d|m-d|d').

props.name: disabledDays
props.desc: An array of days to disable, 0 based. For example, [0, 6] disables Sunday and Saturday (defaults to null).

props.name: disabledDaysText
props.desc: The tooltip to display when the date falls on a disabled day (defaults to 'Disabled')

props.name: disabledDates
props.desc:
An array of "dates" to disable, as strings. These strings will be used to build a dynamic regular expression so they are very powerful. Some examples:
  • ["03/08/2003", "09/16/2003"] would disable those exact dates
  • ["03/08", "09/16"] would disable those days for every year
  • ["^03/08"] would only match the beginning (useful if you are using short years)
  • ["03/../2006"] would disable every day in March 2006
  • ["^03"] would disable every day in every March
In order to support regular expressions, if you are using a date format that has "." in it, you will have to escape the dot when restricting dates. For example: ["03\\.08\\.03"].

props.name: disabledDatesText
props.desc: The tooltip text to display when the date falls on a disabled date (defaults to 'Disabled')

props.name: minValue
props.desc:
The minimum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a
valid format (defaults to null).

props.name: maxValue
props.desc:
The maximum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a
valid format (defaults to null).

props.name: minText
props.desc:
The error text to display when the date in the cell is before minValue (defaults to
'The date in this field must be after {minValue}').

props.name: maxText
props.desc:
The error text to display when the date in the cell is after maxValue (defaults to
'The date in this field must be before {maxValue}').

props.name: invalidText
props.desc:
The error text to display when the date in the field is invalid (defaults to
'{value} is not a valid date - it must be in the format {format}').

props.name: triggerClass
props.desc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the class 'x-form-trigger' and triggerClass will be appended if specified (defaults to 'x-form-date-trigger' which displays a calendar icon).

props.name: useIso
props.desc:
if enabled, then the date field will use a hidden field to store the 
real value as iso formated date. default (false)

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to
{tag: "input", type: "text", size: "10", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: fck
props.desc: options - see fck manual for details.

props.name: growMin
props.desc: The minimum height to allow when grow = true (defaults to 60)

props.name: growMax
props.desc: The maximum height to allow when grow = true (defaults to 1000)

props.name: preventScrollbars
props.desc:
True to prevent scrollbars from appearing regardless of how much text is
in the field (equivalent to setting overflow: hidden, defaults to false)

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to
{tag: "textarea", style: "width:300px;height:60px;", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: grow
props.desc: True if this field should automatically grow and shrink to its content

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false)

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

props.name: emptyText
props.desc: The default text to display in an empty field (defaults to null).

props.name: emptyClass
props.desc:
The CSS class to apply to an empty field to style the {@link #emptyText} (defaults to
'x-form-empty-field').  This class is automatically added and removed as needed depending on the current field value.

props.name: fieldLabel
props.desc: Label to use when rendering a form.

props.name: qtip
props.desc: Mouse over tip

props.name: name
props.desc: The field's HTML name attribute.

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: invalidText
props.desc: The error text to use when marking a field invalid and no message is provided (defaults to "The value in this field is invalid")

props.name: focusClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

props.name: validationEvent
props.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

props.name: validateOnBlur
props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay
props.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

props.name: fieldClass
props.desc: The default CSS class for the field (defaults to "x-form-field")

props.name: msgTarget
props.desc:
The location where error text should display. Should be one of the following values (defaults to 'qtip'): 
Value         Description
-----------   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
qtip          Display a quick tip when the user hovers over the field
title         Display a default browser title attribute popup
under         Add a block div beneath the field containing the error text
side          Add an error icon to the right of the field with a popup on hover
[element id]  Add the error text directly to the innerHTML of the specified element

props.name: msgFx
props.desc: Experimental The effect used when displaying a validation message under the field (defaults to 'normal').

props.name: readOnly
props.desc: True to mark the field as readOnly in HTML (defaults to false) -- Note: this only sets the element's readOnly DOM attribute.

props.name: disabled
props.desc: True to disable the field (defaults to false).

props.name: inputType
props.desc: The type attribute for input fields -- e.g. radio, text, password (defaults to "text").

props.name: tabIndex
props.desc: The tabIndex for this field. Note this only applies to fields that are rendered, not those which are built via applyTo (defaults to undefined).

props.name: value
props.desc: A value to initialize this field with.

props.name: cls
props.desc: A CSS class to apply to the field's underlying element.

props.name: width
props.desc: width (optional) size of component

props.name: height
props.desc: height (optional) size of component

props.name: disableClass
props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.name: allowDomMove
props.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

props.name: hideMode
props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

props.name: actionMode
props.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

props.desc: A css class to apply to the x-form-item of fields. This property cascades to child containers.

props.desc: Valid values are "left," "center" and "right" (defaults to "center")

props.name: minButtonWidth
props.desc: Minimum width of all buttons in pixels (defaults to 75)

props.name: labelAlign
props.desc:
Valid values are "left," "top" and "right" (defaults to "left").
This property cascades to child containers if not set.

props.name: monitorValid
props.desc: If true the form monitors its valid state client-side and fires a looping event with that state. This is required to bind buttons to the valid state using the config value formBind:true on the button.

props.name: monitorPoll
props.desc: The milliseconds to poll valid state, ignored if monitorValid is not true (defaults to 200)

props.name: progressUrl
props.desc: - Url to return progress data

props.name: method
props.desc: The request method to use (GET or POST) for form actions if one isn't supplied in the action options.

props.name: reader
props.desc:
An Roo.data.DataReader (e.g. {@link Roo.data.XmlReader}) to be used to read data when executing "load" actions.
This is optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON.

props.name: errorReader
props.desc:
An Roo.data.DataReader (e.g. {@link Roo.data.XmlReader}) to be used to read data when reading validation errors on "submit" actions.
This is completely optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON.

props.name: url
props.desc: The URL to use for form actions if one isn't supplied in the action options.

props.name: fileUpload
props.desc: Set to true if this form is a file upload.

props.name: baseParams
props.desc: Parameters to pass with all requests. e.g. baseParams: {id: '123', foo: 'bar'}.

props.name: timeout
props.desc: Timeout for form actions in seconds (default is 30 seconds).

props.name: trackResetOnLoad
props.desc:
If set to true, form.reset() resets to the last loaded
or setValues() data instead of when the form was first created.

The location where error text should display. Should be one of the following values (defaults to 'qtip'): 
Value         Description

props.name: fieldClass
props.desc: The default CSS class for the field (defaults to "x-form-field x-form-num-field")

props.name: allowDecimals
props.desc: False to disallow decimal values (defaults to true)

props.name: decimalSeparator
props.desc: Character(s) to allow as the decimal separator (defaults to '.')

props.name: decimalPrecision
props.desc: The maximum precision to display after the decimal separator (defaults to 2)

props.name: allowNegative
props.desc: False to prevent entering a negative sign (defaults to true)

props.name: minValue
props.desc: The minimum allowed value (defaults to Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY)

props.name: maxValue
props.desc: The maximum allowed value (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum value validation fails (defaults to "The minimum value for this field is {minValue}")

props.name: maxText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum value validation fails (defaults to "The maximum value for this field is {maxValue}")

props.name: nanText
props.desc:
Error text to display if the value is not a valid number.  For example, this can happen
if a valid character like '.' or '-' is left in the field with no number (defaults to "{value} is not a valid number")

props.name: grow
props.desc: True if this field should automatically grow and shrink to its content

props.name: growMin
props.desc: The minimum width to allow when grow = true (defaults to 30)

props.name: growMax
props.desc: The maximum width to allow when grow = true (defaults to 800)

props.name: vtype
props.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

props.name: maskRe
props.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

props.name: disableKeyFilter
props.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

props.name: allowBlank
props.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

props.name: minLength
props.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

props.name: maxLength
props.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

props.name: minLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

props.name: maxLengthText
props.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.desc: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false)

props.name: blankText
props.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

props.name: validator
props.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

props.name: regex
props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

props.name: regexText
props.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

props.name: emptyText
props.desc: The default text to display in an empty field (defaults to null).

props.name: emptyClass
props.desc:
The CSS class to apply to an empty field to style the {@link #emptyText} (defaults to
'x-form-empty-field').  This class is automatically added and removed as needed depending on the current field value.

props.name: name
props.desc: The field's HTML name attribute.

props.name: invalidClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

props.name: invalidText
props.desc: The error text to use when marking a field invalid and no message is provided (defaults to "The value in this field is invalid")

props.name: focusClass
props.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

props.name: validationEvent
props.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable

props.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

props.name: validationDelay

events.name: beforerowselect
events.desc: Fires before a cell is selected.

events.desc: Fires when a cell is selected.

events.name: selectionchange
events.desc: Fires when the active selection changes.

props.name: header
props.desc: The header text to display in the Grid view.

props.name: dataIndex
props.desc:
(Optional) The name of the field in the grid's {@link Roo.data.Store}'s
{@link Roo.data.Record} definition from which to draw the column's value. If not
specified, the column's index is used as an index into the Record's data Array.

props.name: width
props.desc:
(Optional) The initial width in pixels of the column. Using this
instead of {@link Roo.grid.Grid#autoSizeColumns} is more efficient.

props.name: sortable
props.desc:
(Optional) True if sorting is to be allowed on this column.
Defaults to the value of the {@link #defaultSortable} property.
Whether local/remote sorting is used is specified in {@link Roo.data.Store#remoteSort}.

props.name: locked
props.desc: (Optional) True to lock the column in place while scrolling the Grid.  Defaults to false.

props.name: fixed
props.desc: (Optional) True if the column width cannot be changed.  Defaults to false.

props.name: resizable
props.desc: (Optional) False to disable column resizing. Defaults to true.

props.name: hidden
props.desc: (Optional) True to hide the column. Defaults to false.

props.name: renderer
props.desc:
(Optional) A function used to generate HTML markup for a cell
given the cell's data value. See {@link #setRenderer}. If not specified, the
default renderer uses the raw data value.

props.name: editor
props.desc: (Optional) For grid editors - returns the grid editor

props.name: align
props.desc: (Optional) Set the CSS text-align property of the column.  Defaults to undefined.

props.name: listeners

events.name: columlockchange
events.desc: Fires when a column's locked state is changed

events.name: columnmoved
events.desc: Fires when a column is moved.

events.name: headerchange
events.desc: Fires when the text of a header changes.

events.name: hiddenchange
events.desc: Fires when a column is hidden or "unhidden".

events.name: widthchange
events.desc: Fires when the width of a column changes.

props.name: clicksToEdit
props.desc: The number of clicks on a cell required to display the cell's editor (defaults to 2)

props.name: ddGroup
props.desc: - drag drop group.

props.name: enableDrag
props.desc: True to enable drag of rows. Default is false. (double check if this is needed?)

props.name: autoWidth
props.desc:
True to set the grid's width to the default total width of the grid's columns instead
of a fixed width. Default is false.

props.name: maxHeight
props.desc: Sets the maximum height of the grid - ignored if autoHeight is not on.

props.name: minColumnWidth
props.desc: The minimum width a column can be resized to. Default is 25.

props.name: autoSizeColumns
props.desc: True to automatically resize the columns to fit their content on initial render. It is more efficient to explicitly size the columns through the ColumnModel's {@link Roo.grid.ColumnModel#width} config option. Default is false.

props.name: autoSizeHeaders
props.desc: True to measure headers with column data when auto sizing columns. Default is true.

props.name: monitorWindowResize
props.desc: True to autoSize the grid when the window resizes. Default is true.

props.name: maxRowsToMeasure
props.desc:
If autoSizeColumns is on, maxRowsToMeasure can be used to limit the number of
rows measured to get a columns size. Default is 0 (all rows).

props.name: trackMouseOver
props.desc: True to highlight rows when the mouse is over. Default is true.

props.name: enableDragDrop
props.desc: True to enable drag and drop of rows. Default is false.

props.name: enableColumnMove
props.desc: True to enable drag and drop reorder of columns. Default is true.

props.name: enableColumnHide
props.desc: True to enable hiding of columns with the header context menu. Default is true.

props.name: enableRowHeightSync
props.desc: True to manually sync row heights across locked and not locked rows. Default is false.

props.name: stripeRows
props.desc: True to stripe the rows.  Default is true.

props.name: autoHeight
props.desc: True to fit the height of the grid container to the height of the data. Default is false.

props.name: autoExpandColumn
props.desc: The id (or dataIndex) of a column in this grid that should expand to fill unused space. This id can not be 0. Default is false.

props.name: autoExpandMin
props.desc:
The minimum width the autoExpandColumn can have (if enabled).
Default is 50.

props.name: autoExpandMax
props.desc: The maximum width the autoExpandColumn can have (if enabled). Default is 1000.

props.name: view
props.desc: The {@link Roo.grid.GridView} used by the grid. This can be set before a call to render().

props.name: loadMask
props.desc: An {@link Roo.LoadMask} config or true to mask the grid while loading. Default is false.

props.name: dragTarget
props.desc: An {@link Roo.dd.DragTarget} config

events.name: afteredit
events.desc:
Fires after a cell is edited.
  • grid - This grid
  • record - The record being edited
  • field - The field name being edited
  • value - The value being set
  • originalValue - The original value for the field, before the edit.
  • row - The grid row index
  • column - The grid column index

events.name: beforeedit
events.desc:
Fires before cell editing is triggered. The edit event object has the following properties
  • grid - This grid
  • record - The record being edited
  • field - The field name being edited
  • value - The value for the field being edited.
  • row - The grid row index
  • column - The grid column index
  • cancel - Set this to true to cancel the edit or return false from your handler.

events.name: validateedit
events.desc:
Fires after a cell is edited, but before the value is set in the record. You can use this to modify the value being set in the field, Return false to cancel the change. The edit event object has the following properties
  • editor - This editor
  • grid - This grid
  • record - The record being edited
  • field - The field name being edited
  • value - The value being set
  • originalValue - The original value for the field, before the edit.

props.name: autoWidth

True to set the grid's width to the default total width of the grid's columns instead
of a fixed width. Default is false.

props.name: maxHeight
props.desc: Sets the maximum height of the grid - ignored if autoHeight is not on.

props.name: minColumnWidth
props.desc: The minimum width a column can be resized to. Default is 25.

props.name: autoSizeColumns
props.desc: True to automatically resize the columns to fit their content on initial render. It is more efficient to explicitly size the columns through the ColumnModel's {@link Roo.grid.ColumnModel#width} config option. Default is false.

props.name: autoSizeHeaders
props.desc: True to measure headers with column data when auto sizing columns. Default is true.

props.name: monitorWindowResize
props.desc: True to autoSize the grid when the window resizes. Default is true.

props.name: maxRowsToMeasure
props.desc:
If autoSizeColumns is on, maxRowsToMeasure can be used to limit the number of
rows measured to get a columns size. Default is 0 (all rows).

props.name: trackMouseOver
props.desc: True to highlight rows when the mouse is over. Default is true.

props.name: enableDragDrop
props.desc: True to enable drag and drop of rows. Default is false.

props.desc: True to enable drag and drop reorder of columns. Default is true.

props.name: enableColumnHide
props.desc: True to enable hiding of columns with the header context menu. Default is true.

props.name: enableRowHeightSync
props.desc: True to manually sync row heights across locked and not locked rows. Default is false.

props.name: stripeRows
props.desc: True to stripe the rows.  Default is true.

props.name: autoHeight
props.desc: True to fit the height of the grid container to the height of the data. Default is false.

props.name: autoExpandColumn
props.desc: The id (or dataIndex) of a column in this grid that should expand to fill unused space. This id can not be 0. Default is false.

props.name: autoExpandMin
props.desc:
The minimum width the autoExpandColumn can have (if enabled).
Default is 50.

props.name: autoExpandMax
props.desc: The maximum width the autoExpandColumn can have (if enabled). Default is 1000.

props.desc:
True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field, "width" to adopt the width only,
or "height" to adopt the height only (defaults to false)

props.name: revertInvalid
props.desc:
True to automatically revert the field value and cancel the edit when the user completes an edit and the field
validation fails (defaults to true)

props.name: ignoreNoChange
props.desc:
True to skip the the edit completion process (no save, no events fired) if the user completes an edit and
the value has not changed (defaults to false).  Applies only to string values - edits for other data types
will never be ignored.

props.name: hideEl
props.desc: False to keep the bound element visible while the editor is displayed (defaults to true)

props.desc: The data value of the underlying field (defaults to "")

props.name: alignment
props.desc: The position to align to (see {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for more details, defaults to "c-c?").

props.name: shadow
props.desc:
"sides" for sides/bottom only, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop"
for bottom-right shadow (defaults to "frame")

props.name: constrain
props.desc: True to constrain the editor to the viewport

props.name: completeOnEnter
props.desc: True to complete the edit when the enter key is pressed (defaults to false)

props.name: cancelOnEsc
props.desc: True to cancel the edit when the escape key is pressed (defaults to false)

props.name: updateEl
props.desc: True to update the innerHTML of the bound element when the update completes (defaults to false)

props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.name: allowDomMove
props.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

props.name: hideMode
props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()

field.  Saving the change to the field can be canceled by returning false from the handler of this event.
Note that if the value has not changed and ignoreNoChange = true, the editing will still end but this
event will not fire since no edit actually occurred.

props.desc: false to disable node highlight on drop (defaults to the value of Roo.enableFx)

props.name: hlColor
props.desc: The color of the node highlight (defaults to C3DAF9)

props.name: animate
props.desc: true to enable animated expand/collapse (defaults to the value of Roo.enableFx)

props.name: singleExpand
props.desc: true if only 1 node per branch may be expanded

props.name: selModel
props.desc: A tree selection model to use with this TreePanel (defaults to a {@link Roo.tree.DefaultSelectionModel})

props.name: loader
props.desc: A TreeLoader for use with this TreePanel

props.name: pathSeparator
props.desc: The token used to separate sub-paths in path strings (defaults to '/')

props.name: renderer
props.desc:
Sets the rendering (formatting) function for the nodes. to return HTML markup for the tree view. The render function is called with the following parameters:
  • The {Object} The data for the node.

props.name: rendererTip
props.desc:
Sets the rendering (formatting) function for the nodes hovertip to return HTML markup for the tree view. The render function is called with the following parameters:
  • The {Object} The data for the node.

props.name: listeners

events.name: append
events.desc: Fires when a new child node is appended to a node in this tree.

events.name: beforeappend
events.desc: Fires before a new child is appended to a node in this tree, return false to cancel the append.

events.name: beforechildrenrendered
events.desc: Fires right before the child nodes for a node are rendered

events.name: beforeclick
events.desc: Fires before click processing on a node. Return false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecollapse
events.desc: Fires before a node is collapsed, return false to cancel.

events.name: beforeexpand
events.desc: Fires before a node is expanded, return false to cancel.

events.name: beforeinsert
events.desc: Fires before a new child is inserted in a node in this tree, return false to cancel the insert.

events.name: beforeload
events.desc: Fires before a node is loaded, return false to cancel

events.name: beforemove
events.desc: Fires before a node is moved to a new location in the tree. Return false to cancel the move.

events.name: beforenodedrop
events.desc:
Fires when a DD object is dropped on a node in this tree for preprocessing. Return false to cancel the drop. The dropEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Drop node(s) provided by the source OR you can supply node(s) to be inserted by setting them on this object.
  • cancel - Set this to true to cancel the drop.

events.name: beforeremove
events.desc: Fires before a child is removed from a node in this tree, return false to cancel the remove.

events.name: checkchange
events.desc: Fires when a node with a checkbox's checked property changes

events.name: click
events.desc: Fires when a node is clicked

events.name: collapse
events.desc: Fires when a node is collapsed

events.name: contextmenu
events.desc: Fires when a node is right clicked

events.name: dblclick
events.desc: Fires when a node is double clicked

events.name: disabledchange
events.desc: Fires when the disabled status of a node changes

events.name: dragdrop
events.desc: Fires when a dragged node is dropped on a valid DD target

events.name: enddrag
events.desc: Fires when a drag operation is complete

events.name: expand
events.desc: Fires when a node is expanded

events.name: insert
events.desc: Fires when a new child node is inserted in a node in this tree.

events.name: load
events.desc: Fires when a node is loaded

events.name: move
events.desc: Fires when a node is moved to a new location in the tree

events.name: nodedragover
events.desc:
Fires when a tree node is being targeted for a drag drop, return false to signal drop not allowed. The dragOverEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Drop node(s) provided by the source.
  • cancel - Set this to true to signal drop not allowed.

events.name: nodedrop
events.desc:
Fires after a DD object is dropped on a node in this tree. The dropEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Dropped node(s).

events.name: remove
events.desc: Fires when a child node is removed from a node in this tree.

events.name: startdrag
events.desc: Fires when a node starts being dragged

events.name: textchange
events.desc: Fires when the text for a node is changed

props.name: folderSort
props.desc: True to sort leaf nodes under non leaf nodes

props.name: property
props.desc: The named attribute on the node to sort by (defaults to text)

props.name: dir
props.desc: The direction to sort (asc or desc) (defaults to asc)

props.name: leafAttr
props.desc: The attribute used to determine leaf nodes in folder sort (defaults to "leaf")

props.name: caseSensitive
props.desc: true for case sensitive sort (defaults to false)

props.name: sortType
props.desc: A custom "casting" function used to convert node values before sorting

props.name: el
props.desc: The element to act as a button.

props.name: delay
props.desc:
The initial delay before the repeating event begins firing.
Similar to an autorepeat key delay.

props.name: interval
props.desc: The interval between firings of the "click" event. Default 10 ms.

props.name: pressClass
props.desc: A CSS class name to be applied to the element while pressed.

props.name: accelerate
props.desc:
True if autorepeating should start slowly and accelerate.
          "interval" and "delay" are ignored. "immediate" is honored.

props.name: preventDefault
props.desc: True to prevent the default click event

props.name: stopDefault
props.desc: True to stop the default click event

events.name: mousedown
events.desc: Fires when the mouse button is depressed.

events.name: mouseup
events.desc: Fires when the mouse key is released.
